definition: power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The Leaf is an all-electric vehicle that is designed for short commutes.
sentences.chinese: 聆风则是专为短途代步而设计的电动车。

sentences.english: This article introduces the Data Collecting System in the Multi-function Car for Test and Inspection of Vehicles in Specific Sites and Area.
sentences.chinese: 介绍厂内机动车辆综合检测车的数据检测采集系统。

sentences.english: A motor vehicle which reaches the standards for being discarded as unserviceable shall not run on road.
sentences.chinese: 达到报废标准的机动车不得上道路行驶。

sentences.english: Set of bollards for blocking vehicle access.
sentences.chinese: 阻止机动车通行的一组安全岛护柱。

sentences.english: Don't you smell the gas from the motors all around the streets?
sentences.chinese: 难道你没有在街上闻到从机动车上排出来的气体吗？

sentences.english: Any other vehicle on which exemption is granted on the approval of the Provincial TLIA.
sentences.chinese: 经省交通征费稽查机构核准免征的其他机动车。

sentences.english: Cars will be restricted based on the odd and even number rule for 46 days, starting today.
sentences.chinese: 在此期间，有46天将实行机动车单双号限行。

sentences.english: Yesterday, the bullet train tickets were among the first to be sold out.
sentences.chinese: 昨天最早售罄的是动车组的票。

sentences.english: This would "create a basis for future hybrid and electric vehicles, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这为“将来的混合型电动车创造了基础。”

sentences.english: The motor and garage trades will be harmed.
sentences.chinese: 机动车买卖和车辆修理业也将受损。

sentences.english: We produce bicycle saddles forE- bike and supply them with good quality and competitive price.
sentences.chinese: 我司生产各种电动车鞍座，质量好价格优，欢迎选购。

sentences.english: Non- motorized access will be in the "three vertical and three horizontal" peripheral gradually open up.
sentences.chinese: 非机动车通道将在“三横三纵”的周边陆续开辟。

sentences.english: I fell off my moped and I got a bruise.
sentences.chinese: 我从助动车上摔下来并擦伤了。

sentences.english: The second generation of greenway is characterized by trail-oriented and non-motorized travel.
sentences.chinese: 第二代绿道以步道和非机动车通行为特点。

sentences.english: This method is especially suitable to measurement of exhaust gas of vehicle by roadside.
sentences.chinese: 该方法尤其适合机动车道边附近的测量。

sentences.english: The two trains were carrying a combined 1,630 passengers.
sentences.chinese: 两辆动车一共承载旅客达1630人。

definition: green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Railway, completed in 2010/abbr. for 京滬高速鐵路|京沪高速铁路
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
(of trains etc) to set off (on a journey)/to start (being issued or circulated)/to start (happening)/originating
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
